item.title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 soundtrack details rolled out
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/tony-hawks-pro-skater-3-4-soundtrack-details-rolled-out

Earlier this month and after a few unintentional slips, Activision officially announced that Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 and 4 are coming back, with the two games getting remade from the ground up.

If you are anything like me, one of the things you will recall fondly when thinking back to those hazy days of playing Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 and 4 on their initial release are the games' soundtracks. Grinding and flipping along to the likes of Alien Ant Farm and Sum 41. Ah, those were the days.

Anyway, with the upcoming combined remakes, players are probably interested in finding out what the soundtrack will include. On that initial announcement, Activision promised the remakes will include songs from the original games such as Ace of Spades by Motörhead, as well as new tracks which "capture the spirit of modern skate culture". And now, we know more songs that will be included on the games' combined rerelease, thanks to Spotify (via IGN).

The songs we currently know will be included on Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 release are:

  • Ace of Spades by Motörhead
  • Them Bones by Alice in Chains
  • Ultimate by Denzel Curry
  • Damaged Goods by Gang of Four
  • 96 Quite Bitter Beings by CKY
  • Yankee and the Brave (Ep. 4) by Run the Jewels
  • King of the Beach by Wavves
  • Real Thing by Turnstile
  • Not the Same by Bodyjar
  • New Wage Salary by End It
  • Head by Jeff Rosenstock
  • Collard Greens by Schoolboy Q and Kendrick Lamar
  • Outta Here by KRS-One
  • Result by TCMF
  • Dog Years by Urethane
  • Charlotte by Kittie
  • Mass Appeal by Gang Starr
  • Faster than the World by H20
  • Roadkill by Starcrawler
  • Amoeba by Adolescents

Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 will be released across PlayStation 4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, PC (via Steam, Battle.net and Microsoft Store), and Nintendo Switch on 11th July. It will also be coming to Game Pass Ultimate and Game Pass PC.

On its release, there will be some changes to how things work in the remake of Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 4.
